100.text: Educational programming improves general knowledge and awareness.
Public broadcasters provide accessible news and civic information.
Excessive TV consumption correlates with sedentary lifestyle and health risks.
Sensationalist content can distort public perception and reduce attention spans.

101.text: Documentaries and science shows increase interest in STEM among students.
Language-learning channels support early vocabulary development.

201.text: Higher daily TV time is associated with lower physical activity in teens.
Late-night TV use is linked with sleep disruption and reduced academic focus.
